channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Migration guide to Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deployment guide to set up, onboard, or move to Intune. These steps include moving from partner MDM providers, using co-management, moving from on-premises group policy, and moving from Office 365 device management.

item.title: Use Microsoft Tunnel VPN gateway with Conditional Access policies
item.description: Configure your Azure tenant to support using Conditional Access policies to grant access to the Intune Microsoft Tunnel VPN gateway solution.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Upgrade the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway server software
item.description: Understand how Microsoft Tunnel Gateway upgrades to new versions of the tunnel software for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Platforms and policy types supported by filters in Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the supported apps, compliance policies, and device configuration profiles that support filters in Intune.

item.title: Use the settings catalog to configure DDM software updates
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Apple's declarative device management (DDM) settings to install a specific update by an enforced deadline. This feature uses the settings catalog to configure managed software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS and managed macOS devices.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies to manage macOS software updates
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised macOS devices.

item.title: Admin checklist for iOS/iPadOS software updates in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune. See sample policy for different industry scenarios, including shared devices, kiosk, manufacturing, and information worker.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to manage software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Admin guide and checklist for macOS software updates
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updates for macOS devices using Microsoft Intune. Use this article to help manage software updates on your organization-owned devices, including how to create policies, manage updates, and review update status.

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using a Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Tutorial-Get started with cloud-native Windows endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up secure cloud-native Windows endpoints that are Microsoft Entra joined, enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Supported Microsoft Intune apps
item.description: This article provides lists of support partner and Microsoft apps that are commonly used with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for macOS
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned Macs into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Intune Graph API - Reports and properties
item.description: Learn about Intune reports and properties provided via Graph API.

item.title: Retire or wipe devices using Microsoft Intune
item.description: Retire or wipe a device on an Android, Android work profile, AOSP, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, or Windows device using Microsoft Intune. Also delete a device from Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Configure policies to manage Endpoint Privilege Management with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure policies that define how Endpoint Privilege Management functions in your tenant, and behaviors when elevating files to run in administrative context.

item.title: Create Intune policies to configure and manage Windows LAPS
item.description: Create policies to manage the Windows Local Administrator Policy Solution (LAPS) on Windows devices that enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Zebra Mobility Extensions on Android devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and use Zebra devices running Android with Zebra Mobility Extensions (MX). See all the steps, including install the Company Portal app, sideload the app, assign device administrator role, create a StageNow profile, and more.

item.title: Use OEMConfig on Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and use devices running Android Enterprise with OEMConfig. See all the steps, including an overview, see the prerequisites, create the configuration profile in Intune, and see a list of supported OEMConfig apps.

item.title: Android app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Use Remote Help to assist users authenticated by your organization.
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Properties catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Properties catalog policy to manage Device Inventory settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Configure the Jamf Pro Cloud Connector to integrate Jamf Pro with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Jamf Cloud Connector to integrate Jamf Pro with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up Jamf Mobile Threat Protection integration with Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the Jamf Mobile Threat Protection solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Add and assign MTD apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to add Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) apps, Microsoft Authenticator app, and iOS configuration policy in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Configure iOS/iPadOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) plug-in. Add or create an iOS or iPadOS device configuration profile using the Microsoft Enterprise SSO plug-in app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to get information about your Intune data, including devices, apps, policies, and groups managed in Intune. You can also compare policies, get device specific details, and get target info for policies.

item.title: Microsoft Copilot in Intune features overview
item.description: Microsoft Copilot in Intune is an AI platform. It can help you create policies, get information about existing policies, and show more details on specific settings, including their impacts on users and devices. You can also use Copilot to troubleshoot device issues.

item.title: Explore Intune data with natural language and take action
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, use Explorer to query your data in natural language and run built-in queries that match your request. Copilot summarizes the results, and provides recommendations and actions based on the query results. You can also create policies that target users and groups in the query results. Use this feature to explore your Intune data, troubleshoot issues, and create custom reports.

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Surface Management Portal
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to help you manage and monitor Surface devices at scale.

item.title: Copilot in Intune shows device information and errors
item.description: Microsoft Copilot in Intune can help you get information about your devices, compare devices, and get error information. Use this information to help you manage and troubleshoot device issues.

item.title: Copilot in Intune FAQ
item.description: Get answers to common questions when using Copilot in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot the Enrollment Status Page (ESP) - Intune
item.description: General troubleshooting guide for the Enrollment Status Page (ESP) for Windows Autopilot or OOBE for Microsoft Entra join.

item.title: Deploy OMA-URIs to target a CSP through Intune, and a comparison to on-premises - Intune
item.description: This article describes the significance of CSPs, Open Mobile Alliance – Uniform Resources (OMA-URIs), and how custom mobile device management (MDM) policies are delivered to a Windows 10-based device with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot auto-enrolling existing Configuration Manager devices in Intune - Intune
item.description: Helps you understand and troubleshoot issues when you set up co-management by taking Path 1 - Auto-enroll existing Configuration Manager-managed devices into Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot Windows 10 Intune auto-enrollment error 80180002b - Intune
item.description: Fixes an issue in which Windows 10 Group Policy-based auto-enrollment to Microsoft Intune fails with the error code 0x80180002b in Event Viewer.

item.title: Troubleshooting Intune and Configuration Manager co-management workloads - Intune
item.description: Helps you understand and troubleshoot issues that you may encounter when you configure workloads in an Intune and Configuration Manager co-management environment.

item.title: Error 0x87D13BA2 deploying a macOS LOB app in Intune - Intune
item.description: Fixes the 0x87D13BA2 error when you deploy a macOS LOB app that contains multiple components in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: How to configure Android enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune - Intune
item.description: This guide describes how to configure Android enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: MDM enrollment error 0xcaa9001f for co-managed Windows devices - Intune
item.description: Describes an issue in which MDM enrollment fails and generates error 0xcaa9001f for co-managed Windows devices that are Microsoft Entra hybrid joined and managed by using Configuration Manager.

item.title: Troubleshoot Microsoft Entra device registration and Windows Autopilot - Intune
item.description: Provides tips for troubleshooting Microsoft Entra device registration and Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Tips for assigning device password settings to Android Enterprise fully managed devices in Intune - Intune
item.description: Describes different behavior when a device restrictions profile that includes password settings is assigned to Android Enterprise fully managed devices before and after enrollment.

item.title: Troubleshoot Configuration Management bootstrap with modern provisioning - Intune
item.description: Helps you understand and troubleshoot issues that you may encounter when you set up co-management by taking path 2 - Bootstrap the Configuration Manager client with modern provisioning.

item.title: Sysprep will not run correctly on a Windows 10 device that has been MDM enrolled - Intune
item.description: Provides tips for troubleshooting when Sysprep will not run correctly on a Windows 10 device that has been enrolled in mobile device management.

item.title: Error 0x80090014 installing NDES certificate - Intune
item.description: Gives the resolution for an issue where the NDES connector for Microsoft Intune fails to install because the NDES certificate isn't installed.

item.title: Error 0x80004003 signing in to the Intune NDES Connector UI - Intune
item.description: Troubleshoot an unexpected error and an 0x80004003 error during sign-in to the Intune Certificate NDES UI when you configure NDES.

item.title: Troubleshoot Update ring policies for Windows devices - Intune
item.description: Provides troubleshooting guidance for configuring Update ring policies for Windows 10 and Windows 11 devices in Intune.

item.title: Support Tip - Understanding the flow behind deployment, delivery, and processing of a Win32 application through Intune - Intune
item.description: This article highlights and explains the flow that is associated with a Win32 app during its deployment, delivery, and processing through Intune.

item.title: Keychain error -25244 when enrolling macOS devices in Intune - Intune
item.description: Describes an issue in which you can't enroll a macOS device in Microsoft Intune because of stale or corrupted keychain entries.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Security Copilot Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up and use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent for Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Microsoft Intune built-in roles reference
item.description: Permissions reference for built-in roles for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Onboard and Configure Devices with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint via Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune, including connecting the products, onboarding devices, and assigning policies for compliance and risk level assessment.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices.

item.title: Shared iPad devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iPad devices.

item.title: Use multiple administrative approvals in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure multi-admin approval to protect your tenant against the use of compromised administrative accounts in Intune.

item.title: Manage Windows LAPS with Microsoft Intune policies
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune application protection policy to manage the local administrator accounts on Windows devices. Through the Windows LAPS CSP, back up accounts and passwords to Microsoft Entra ID, define password requirements, and protect account passwords through scheduled password rotations and manual rotations at need.

item.title: Tutorial - Use Microsoft Intune to protect Exchange Online email from unmanaged iOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune app protection policies and Conditional Access to prevent unmanaged iOS devices from accessing Exchange Online.

item.title: Install the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Install and configure Microsoft Tunnel Gateway on a Linux server to support Intune managed cloud-based devices in connecting to your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Government Service overview
item.description: Learn more about the Intune government service offerings and features. This article is designed to serve as an overview of the Microsoft Intune offering for government community cloud (GCC) High and United States Department of Defense (DoD) environments.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add groups to organize users and devices for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create Microsoft Entra groups to organize users and devices for use with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assign a role to an Intune administrator
item.description: Learn how to assign a built-in or custom role to a user in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure a custom domain name - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a custom domain name for your Microsoft Intune subscription

item.title: View ChromeOS device information
item.description: View ChromeOS devices and details synced with the Chrome Enterprise connector in the Microsoft Intune admin center.

item.title: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags for distributed IT - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags to filter configuration profiles to specific roles.

item.title: Assign Microsoft Intune licenses
item.description: Assign licenses to users so they can enroll in Intune

item.title: Create a custom role in Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a custom role in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add users to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and managing Microsoft Entra user accounts from within Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Sign up or sign in to Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to sign up for a Microsoft Intune subscription or sign in to start with your subscription.

item.title: Use SCEP certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and assign Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Data Intune sends to Google - Microsoft Intune
item.description: List of data that Intune sends to Google when Android enterprise device management is enabled with Intune.

item.title: Add an Enterprise App Catalog app to Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add an Enterprise App Catalog app to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Enterprise Application Management
item.description: Learn about Enterprise App Management and the Enterprise App Catalog in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Android, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, Linux, macOS, and Windows devices in Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Set the mobile device management authority - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to set the mobile device management authority in Microsoft Intune and some key considerations.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS device settings in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add, configure, or create settings on iOS/iPadOS devices to restrict features in Microsoft Intune. Create password requirements, control the locked screen, use built-in apps, add restricted or approved apps, handle bluetooth devices, connect to the cloud for backup and storage, enable kiosk mode, add domains, and control how users interact with the Safari web browser.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Set up Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1 for deploying or setting up Intune. The starting point is to review supported configurations, sign up for the trial, configure the custom domain name, add users and groups to Intune, assign licenses to users, manage roles, grant admin permissions, and set the MDM authority.

item.title: Using Remote Help on Windows to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Remote Help app to provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app, and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows 10/11 in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 client devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device restriction settings for Windows 10/11 in Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the settings and their descriptions for creating device restrictions on Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a configuration profile to control screenshots, password requirements, kiosk settings, apps in the store, Microsoft Edge browser, Microsoft Defender, access to the cloud, start menu, and more in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows 10/11 devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Administrative templates in Microsoft Intune to create groups of settings for Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a device configuration profile. You can control Office programs, Microsoft Edge, access OneDrive, use remote desktop, enable Auto-Play, set power management settings, use HTTP printing, control user sign-in, and change the event log size.

item.title: macOS device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll macOS devices using device enrollment, automated device enrollment (DEP), and Apple Configurator enrollment options in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to import and analyze group policies
item.description: Import and analyze your group policy objects using the Group Policy analytics tool. See the policies that are supported and aren't supported in Intune.

item.title: Configure Universal Print policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to create a Universal Print policy for Windows 10/11 client devices. The policy automatically installs printers on your managed devices.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Supported filter device and app properties & operators in Microsoft Intune
item.description: When using filters, get more information on the device properties, supported operators, and supported Windows OS SKUs, including examples. Use these features to create rule expressions in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create device profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or configure a device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Select the platform type, configure the settings, and add a scope tag. Learn more about applicability rules, and the policy refresh cycle times.

item.title: Configure macOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) app extension plug-in. Add or create an macOS device profile using the SSO app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a Wi-Fi profile for devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the steps to create a Wi-Fi device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Create profiles for Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, Android kiosk, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10/11, and Windows Holographic for Business. Use these profiles to create a WiFi connection to use certificates, choose an EAP type, select an authentication method, enable a proxy, and more.
